article.headline: Cornell 81, Columbia 59
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Freshman Adam Gore scored 17 of his 28 points in the first 8:02 of the second half to lead Cornell to an 81-59 victory over Columbia on Saturday. Cornell (7-11, 2-2 Ivy League) outscored Columbia (8-9, 1-3) 24-8 during that span to a take a 58-45 lead and the Lions never got closer than 10 points thereafter. It was a career high for Gore, who was 5-of-8 from 3-point range. John Baumann led the Lions with 16 points, while Brett Loscalzo had 11 and Ben Nwachukwu 10, all in the first half. Graham Dow scored 19 points for the Big Red with Ryan Rourke and Lenny Collins each adding 10. Cornell scored the game's first 10 points before Mack Montgomery hit a 3-pointer with 15:59 left in the opening half. Columbia, which has lost seven of its last nine games, closed the first half with a 22-10 run to take a 37-34 lead.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
